div.p:
Uttarameru-caturvvedi-maṅkalatt’ iśāna-diśai-brahmeśvara-gṛhattu mahādevarkku Ivv-ūr madhyasthaṉ caāturvvaidya * * *
perumañcikaṉ-ēṉ kurava-ciri-viṣṇukumāra-trivediyār paṅkiṉ vaḻi mutal īṭṭu nālām pāṭakamum irāyūr-t taṭakk-aṭiyār brahmāṇiyār paṅkiṉ vaḻi mutal iṭṭu nālām
pāṭakamuṅ kuṇṭūr-k kantama-c-caṭaṅkaviyār paṅkiṉ vaḻi mutal īṭṭ’ iraṇṭām pāṭakamum imm-muūṉṟu pāṭakamum y-āṉivar pakkal vilaikku-k koṇṭ’ uṭaiyaṉ Avippuṟam-āka-k ku
ṭuttēṉ
ivaṟṟiṉ bhogattāl nityamunnāḻi Arici ney-y uṭppaṭa Iraṇṭu poḻutun tiru-v-amirtu kāṭṭuvāṉ āka-p paṇittōm
brāhmaṇaṉ ārādhitt’ uṇpāṉ āka-p paṇittōm mahāsabhaiyōm

To the Mahādeva of the Īśānadiśā-brahmeśvaragṛha (the temple of the Lord of Brahmā in the north-east direction) in Uttaramēru-caturvedimaṅgala; I, Perumañcikaṉ caturvaidya madhyastha of this village; after placing/giving a capital from vaḻi a share of the honourable Kuravaciri Viṣṇukumāra Trivedin, his fourth plot; after placing/giving a capital from a capital, from a share of the honourable Brahmin lady, wife of of the honourable Taṭakkaṭi of Irāyūr, her fourth plot; after placing/giving a capital from a capital, from a share of the honourable Kantamaccaṭaṅkavi of Kuṇṭūr, his second plot; these three plots, having bought vilaikku-k koṇṭu, literally "got a price for" them from these yāṉivar/āṉivar, I have given them as avippuṟam for the lord uṭaiyaṉ, i.e. Mahādeva of the Īśānadiśā-brahmeśvaragṛha.

Through the enjoyment bhogattāl of these ivaṟṟiṉ, we have ordered/declared, so that there be permanenty nityam one who offers kāṭṭuvāṉ glorious amṛta tiruvamirtu, usually translated as “sacred food-offerings” twice a day so as to include three nāḻis munnāḻi of rice and oil/ghee.
For these three plots we have exempted oḻintōm, literally: excepted, cleared taxes, of whatsoever kind.
We have have ordered/declared so that there be a Brahmin feeding when worshipping.
Thus/So did We, the members of the assembly sabhaiyōm.
Writing of Vastuvidyāmaya, son of Kārīśvara, the ācārya attached to this maṇḍapa.
First edited in (SII 6, no. 356); summarised in (IP no. 78); re-edited and translated for the first time by Emmanuel Francis (2020), based on autopsy and photographs (2019).
